headline: One Dish Chicken and Rice Bake
description: Chicken and rice paired with a creamy mushroom sauce bake together for a delicious one-dish meal that's easy to clean up.
name: One Dish Chicken and Rice Bake
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.75 ounce) can Campbell's® Condensed Cream of Mushroom Soup (Regular, 98% Fat Free or 25% Less Sodium)
0.75 cup uncooked regular long-grain white rice

recipeInstructions.text: Mix soup, water, rice, paprika and black pepper in 2-quart shallow baking dish. Top with chicken. Season with additional paprika and pepper. Cover.
Bake at 375 degrees F 45 minutes or until done.

review.reviewBody: Not bad... I did adjust and use 1 cup water and 1 tsp worshire , season salt and most important 1/2 onion. With season salt and pepper on chicken. Go ahead and try this recipe

I spiced up chicken thighs the way I like them and then quick pan seared them. I sautéed a couple of chopped celery sticks, a medium onion and a large shallot in the same pan until tender. I deglazed with about a half cup of white wine and then added another half cup of bone broth. I stirred that all into the rice/mushroom soup mixture. It was very good, but a lot more work and mess. I just had the stuff on hand and was in the mood to cook. If I was not in the mood to cook, I probably would add Lipton soup to the recipe and leave as is. I used a full cup of rice. I cooked @ 350 for 45 min, but my oven is a bit hot. The chicken temp came out perfect. It is a good recipe because you can easily make it your own if you like, or just enjoy it as is.

I doubled the ingredients for this recipe! I made it with more chicken breasts (8), so I doubled the named ingredients listed. I also seasoned my rice mixture and used chicken broth instead of water.. I also used two 1 cups rice instead of 3/4 as listed. I seasoned my chicken breasts very well and let sit for 10 minutes giving the seasonings time to marinate. I partially steamed mixed veggies and added to the mixture as well and cooked mine on 385 for 1 hr 15 minutes. Some of the rice was undercooked so next time I will adjust cooking time. Other than that, this meal was a family hit with my adjustments!
I marinated the chicken in a homemade Nashville hot recipe... OMG!!!
Family liked it.I will make it again

I did just as the recipe says - I didn’t add the extra water. The rice is delicious! It’s like a mushroom risotto. I did remove the thighs after the 45 minutes and put them back in the oven by themselves to crisp up (I had bone-in, skin-on). Really good!
This is similar to a recipe I found years ago on the rice box. Only difference and BIG difference is adding 1 pouch of Lipton onion soup. You'll be amazed at the taste difference. Love it!
It’s your basic one dish chicken and rice recipe. Definitely bump the rice up to 1 cup so it doesn’t come out runny. Toss in any veggies and seasonings that you’ve got a hankering for and enjoy.
Very easy to make and will satisfy almost any picky eater. Go easy on the spices or you'll be coughing up pepper and paprika like I did. Quick to put together, just wish it cooked a bit quicker.
I will not make this dish again. No flavor in either the Chicken or Rice.
The chicken dinner was a hit with my family, Thank You.

I make this all the time I use either cream of mushroom soup or cream of chicken it works with either one, also i use one pre packaged lipton chicken flavored rice instead of regular rice it gives it more flavor.
I made this last week. it was really good. I might add broccoli next time. Very good meal.

Perfect! Followed the recipe to a t..(okay I'm a rice and added a small handful to the dish)
It came out perfect! Chicken was so tender you could cut it with a fork. Rice was perfect. Not overdone like a lot of claims on here.
If your dish is coming out soggy, try making the dish with thawed chicken, instead of frozen, cause that will add more liquid.

I threw this together for my kids and they loved it. I added fresh, uncooked, green beans on the bottom of the pan and sub'd boneless/skinless thighs. I cooked the casserole the recommended 45 minutes then left it in the oven (off) to sit until they were ready to eat - 30 minutes later. They loved it. We're all craving comfort food right now (COVID19)
I changed almost everything in response to others' reviews.

I probably should have read the reviews first, but overall, turned out well. Main thing I would have changed would have been the water to rice ratio; either less water or more rice. Added a few extra spices before I put it in the oven and put soy sauce on all of it when it came out, helped a lot flavour-wise

It would be fine if the rice finished cooking. I gave it a whole extra half hour in the oven but the rice was still a little gritty so I had to pull the chicken off & finish the rice in the microwave. It took an extra 10 min in the microwave. Once everything was cooked it was ok, but I won't attempt this again. It's not worth the headache.

As a follower not a leader I spiffed up this dish as did others. Chicken stock, paprika, garlic salt, onion flakes, pepper, salt, fresh broccoli, with the mushroom soup and a sprinkle of parsley on the chicken. One hour, covered with foil at 375, then cover off for five minutes......outstanding, with a nice Cabernet!!

This is my go-to dinner recipe for something simple to prep that is delicious.
I always use 1 cup of rice, 1/4 cup of water, and 1 can (10.7oz) of chicken broth. Always turns out tender, flavorful, and my kids actually eat it.

I made this with the following modifications... used cream of mushroom and roasted garlic soup by Campbell's •used a rice blend consisting of wild, red, brown, and white rice • used 1.25 cups chicken stock instead of water • chopped up 1/2 small onions, 1/2 orange bell peppers, and garlic 3 cloves (we like garlic)• added vegetables to soup, stock, and rice mixture • also chopped up about a 4" cube of velveeta cheese and mixed into rice mixture • put a bag of frozen broccoli florets on top of rice mixture • put defrosted chicken breast on top and seasoned chicken as normal - (pepper, garlic powder, smoked paprika, herbed Mrs. Dash)
My family complaint bout not liking it to turn around and smashed it and left a empty dish

This is the third time I've made this recipe. It gets five stars because it's quick, easy and very versatile. Once I didn't have cream of mushroom soup, so I used a jar of Alfredo sauce that I had on hand. I always season chicken before I cook it, and I add Worcestershire sauce to everything. To make it a one dish dinner, I add a frozen vegetable mix which also livens up the rice. My son eats seconds and takes leftovers for lunch the next day. It's a keeper!
It was very easy! I added a small can of diced Ortega chilis and it was perfect! My husband gobbled it down and went back for seconds and thirds!

This dish is so boring as written, which is a real shame. I like to use cream of mushroom with roasted garlic soup, cut the rice to 1/2 cup (only 2 people in my house), but leave the water the same. Then I also add chopped celery, carrots and onions, Italian seasonings and season the chicken with a pre-blended spice mix. This makes it more of a meal and adds a lot of flavor while making the rice creamier.
NEXT TIME USE 2 CANS CREAM OF POTATO SOUP, NO RICE

Subbed water with chicken stock, added turmeric, curry powder, and chopped kale to the rice. Seasoned the chicken with salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, turmeric, and curry. Bumped rice to 1 cup. Chicken was done after 45 minutes, but the rice needed to cook a little longer. Super easy base dish, that is easily customized with different seasonings or vegetables.
The whole family loved it! Even my 11 year old stepson. Thank you for a total winner.
Added ranch seasoning, will make again
I used chicken stock instead of water, I also used seasoned mushroom rice and added fresh mushrooms. Delicious!
I doubled the recipe & Instead of water I used chicken broth! I also cooked it 1hr & 5min bc my chicken breast was frozen. Def a new fav in my house!!!????????
Season to taste! Great as a simple dish, paired great with boiled beets and steamed broccoli!
Add one extra can of cream of chix

I made modifications the second time I cooked this that worked well. I added 1 tbsp of soy sauce to the rice and used a rub for the chicken made from 1 tsp Lawry’s, 1 tsp garlic salt, 1 tsp onion powder, 1 tsp paprika, and a little black pepper left over from what I had ground for the rice. I seasoned the chicken, put it in the pan, and sprinkled the rice with the remaining seasoning, although I still threw out a pinch or two of seasoning. These were all modifications of Monica Keiffer’s modifications. I used bone in chicken thighs instead of breasts, so maybe that is why Monica’s rub made the dish way too salty for me.

This was the first recipe I made in my new 18 quart (large) roaster. I preheat the roaster. I used (3) large cans Cream of mushroom soup, (6) C. Water, 4 1/2-5 C. uncooked White rice (mixed together right in the bottom of the roaster.) Then I pounded a Family Size package of Chicken breasts and put on top of the rice mixture. After which, I sprinkled with lots of black pepper and paprika. Cooked on 375° for just over 45mins. It was moist and delicious! So much better than in the oven! I plan to always make it this way from now on!
Super easy and quite good.
Was simple, easy and straightforward to make. Tasted great. Kids loved it.
Love this recipe and have made it for years. The rice comes out tasting wonderful and the chicken is nice and tender.
Tired of finding highly rated recipes that everybody says are not good until you alter them. This is one of those.

Super great recipe for quick prep and easy dinner. 
The recipe does not call for salt, but I would highly recommend adding salt! The rice and chicken were quite bland without it. 
Also, I added approx 1/4 tsp of rubbed sage, an additional 1/2 c water and 1/2 c rice, and two cans of green beans. The veggie addition worked fabulously in the one dish bake!

Covered it like it said and it slowed the cook. So I scrapped the foil and had to cook for 30 extra minutes. Next time will cook without foil. I also added salt, bay leaves, garlic and onion powder. I used cream of chicken and mushroom instead of just mushroom. Added a lovely extra boost of flavor.
I made this with pheasant breasts. I also used brown rice instead of white rice. I sprinkled a package of onion soup across the top before baking at 375 degrees for 1 1/2 hours. Really good.
Very simple recipe and we loved it. Be sure to cover while baking, otherwise rice may not soften enough.

I chose to brown the chicken first and mix the wet ingredients in that pan (with additial spices) before placing them in the baking dish. I would also mix up the rice with a fork halfway through next time as there were some crunchy ones on top. Served with baby peas. Yum!
It took way longer to cook than the recipe called for. The rice still has wasn’t done all tue way when we finally ate it.
Recipe worked well. A little dry , I would add the extra liquid next time.
very good I substituted chicken broth for the water and also crisped the chicken skin separately in the oven. My husband and I really enjoyed this meal
Read reviews and substituted chicken broth for water and also added some additional spices. A bit boring but would make again for something easy and healthy.
Simply great! Easy to prepare and very yummy. Comfort food

I prepared this ahead of time for my husband to cook for the kids. It was good but a little bland. They topped it with grated Parmigiana. Definitely a fast meal for a busy night. A panko or breadcrumb topping would add much needed texture and flavor to this dish.
I added one packet of Lipton Onion soup dry mix. It really helped the flavor. Excellent with changes
Substituted the rice for a garlic risotto and mixed in fingerling potatoes. It’s a great base recipe to build off of.

Recipe as written is very bland. With the suggested changes by other reviewers it is awesome. I mixed one can cream of mushroom, one cup water, one spoon chicken base, one cup rice, 1/2 T Worcester sauce, 1/2 T minced onion, 1/2 garlic powder together. Seasoned chicken breasts well, then cut in strips and mixed in. Baked at 375 for 40 minutes covered, then set on counter for 5. It was perfect.

I also browned some fresh mushrooms in butter and mixed them in about half way.

I did not have campbell's soup so I used a cup of Fage 0% greek yogurt instead and a chicken bouillon cube - I also added an extra cup of water and left the foil off. It came out perfect. The rice is soft and it had the perfect amount of moisture all around. I also used a cup of vegetable stock because I had some on-hand that I needed to use instead of 1 cup of water.
It was delicious. I'm not a great cook at all. Was looking for something quick and easy. This was it! I took the recommendation of adding Worchester shire and a little paprika.

I like the one-dish idea, but it's a little bland. Here's how to make it more flavorful: up it to 1-1/3 cup of rice, eliminate the water and add 1/3 cup of wine, and either 2 cans of cream of mushroom soup, or 1 can cream of mushroom soup and 1 can of cream of celery soup. Mix the soups and wine and pour half the mixture on top of the rice (really soak the rice so it cooks well), place the chicken in the dish, pour the other half of the soup/wine mixture on top of the chicken, then top it off with a package of dry Lipton's onion soup. Bake one hour, and delish!
U used cream of chicken soup only because one of my fist did not eat mushrooms. Everyone loved it, and it was so easy to make.
Not enough rice
A nice simple and easy recipe that turned out great!

I made changes to the original recipe because it needed more flavor. I added chicken broth instead of water and upped the amount of seasonings plus added garlic powder. I chopped the chicken into chunks and it was delicious! I only gave it 4 stars because the original recipe was a little bland. Good, but bland. With the changes it is a 5 star recipe.
The rice was raw and I cooked the dish for an hour. So disappointed!
Added chopped white onion and minced garlic

My mother used to make something similar to this. I wouldn't say this is the exact recipe my mother used, but it's close. 

I took the advice of a few other reviewers and used chicken broth, as opposed to water, and it seemed to add a lot of flavor. I also chopped up some onion, and used some chopped broccoli, just for some extra flavor. Both seemed to work well in the dish. I left out the paprika, because I don't like the stuff. Still tasted fine. 

One thing I did do was to heat the broth in a saucepan, add the mushroom soup and pepper, and let it simmer for a few minutes, then added it to the rice mixture. I'm not sure that would make the recipe any different than just adding all that into the baking dish. I just thought it would be easier to do it that way.
Love It!! Added veggies, broccoli and cauliflower, Perfect!

I give up....First time making this dish I followed the recipe and it was boring. Plus it took way longer to cook the rice but then the chicken was over done. I decided to give it another try thinking I must have done something wrong. On my second try I added some seasonings and used less soup. It tasted a little bit better but it came out too mushy for me and my family. I’ll stick with cooking chicken and rice separately.
Excellent evening meal for two people. I just halved the recipe. Made a mistake though -- don't use golden mushroom soup.
Easy, quick fix!
Great, basic recipe. For lunch leftovers, I cut up the chicken and mixed with rice. I almost liked it even more that way!
This was supposed to cook in 45 minutes, but when I checked my dish there was WAY too much liquid. Increase baking time to an hour and increase the amount of rice to 1c. I won't make this again.
boring. Took way longer than 45 to cook, chicken was still bleeding and needed an extra 20 min at 400 to be done. Lacked flavour.

I made this for the first time today and I read a few reviews on the recipe before making it and so I did make a few changes and it turned out very, very tasty. I used 1 1/2 cups of chicken broth (I use Knorr's little tub dissolved in boiling water which has a really nice flavor) with 1 full cup of rinsed, long grain white and arborio rice, mixed. When the chicken bouillon was dissolved , I moved 1 1/2 cups of the broth into a 4 cup measuring cup and put the rinsed rise into the hot water and bouillon to start it cooking while I prepared the chicken. Some said that they found this recipe bland so, to the rinsed and dried chicken breasts (medium sized), I used the following spices: a sprinkling of sea salt and black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder on both sides and celery seed just on one side. I did not use paprika as I find it over-powers the other flavors. To the top side of the chicken breasts, I added just a light smear of unsalted butter. I then added the can of mushroom soup to the broth/rice mixture and stirred it well until it was all smoothly mixed and then added about two cups of frozen broccoli florets and mixed them in. I was making this just for the two of us so I used two chicken breasts and the two cups of broccoli florets. The rest of the recipe measurements works for four chicken breasts and servings as well. I poured the rice mixture into the bottom of a lightly buttered two quart casserole dish and placed the seasoned chicken breasts on top w

okay can someone please tell me what I'm doing wrong? I did the can of cream of mushroom soup with roasted garlic and I subbed the water for chicken broth, then I added some extra spices to give it more flavor. it's now been covered in the oven for 45 minutes and the rice is still crunchy! it's 8 in the evening and my family would like to eat dinner, but now I have to leave it cooking for another 30 minutes! I don't understand how others came out perfect and mine is not?
I put in extra mushrooms. I usually use boneless, skinless thighs. It's one of my family's favorite comfort foods.

I added an extra can of soup. It made it creamier. My mother loved it & son couldn't get enough of it.
This will definitely be my go too quick meal.

My family loved this dish. I was afraid it was watery. But once I removed chicken I stirred the rice into the liquid the rice absorbed the liquid. And the rice was creamy and chicken was cooked through. This is do again

This was O K for a quick meal but the race got a bit mushy for me. I followed the recipe except I added a bullion cub with the water. and a chopped red pepper. I may have added too much liquid but I took the lid off and cooked it ten extra minutes which reduced the liquid. Probably will not make again.

The only changes I made were, I used cream of celery soup because I didn't have cream of mushroom. I used jasmine rice because it's our favorite (1 cup), added rosemary garlic seasoning blend and added some cheese in the last 5 minutes of baking. 

The rice was perfectly sticky, and the chicken was tender and did not dry out at all. My husband had seconds so I will definitely make this again!

My trash can thanks you. And I so appreciate the "quick and easy" recipe that ended up wasting two hours of my time. Not to mention the money spent on the ingredients that should have been used to create something edible.
In the 45 minutes of baking time, the chicken was cooked but the rice was not. Very disappointed.
I made this using Cream of Chicken because I don't like Cream of Mushroom. I also used Dirty Rice Mix and added seasonings. This had a lot of flavor and tasted great.

Definitely good, but changed a lot of things based off of other reviews and personal preference. Used 1 c. of rice, and just over a cup of chicken broth instead of water. Also added 1 Tbs. of Worcester sauce as recommended by Monica in the comments, and it was a nice touch. Sprinkled extra spices on top of the chicken breasts once they were in the dish (seasoning salt, garlic powder, chili powder, paprika, and pepper) and covered/baked for over an hour at 375. (Took it out at 45 min and the chicken was still raw. stirred rice around a little under the chicken and bake about 10 min uncovered, then stirred the rice around a bit more, covered, and baked an additional 10ish minutes! Come out a bit mushy, but the chicken was delicious, and the rice texture was fine when combined with bites of chicken.
As is the recipe would be bland and dry. I made a lot of changes and only referred to this recipe for proportions. To me a recipe isn't good if I basically redo half of it.

Great recipe and easy to prep!
Used 26 oz of mushroom soup.
Used Chicken broth instead of water
Added garlic powder to the soup mix
Rubbed chicken with salt, pepper, garlic powder and paprika.
Added parsley after done baking
Really delicious!

took in a few of the suggestions mentioned by previous reviews: substituted using chicken stock, added a bunch of spices including garlic powder, garam masala (which i feel makes this dish really flavorful), increased to 1 cup of rice, and used cream of chicken. put in the oven for an hour, and woo! completely cooked. the chicken was slightly dry,and the rice under the chicken was mushy, but i think that's minor after mixing the rice completely because it's barely noticeable. the only "crunchy" rice was the rice stuck on the sides of my dish (but still cooked!). 

i definitely feel this recipe gives permission to play around with flavoring.

This was very good, but after reading reviews, I altered it a bit. Mixed together 1 cup of white rice, can of cream of mushroom soup, can of mushrooms, 1 cup of chicken stock, 1 tablespoon of Worcestershire sauce, ½ teas of poultry seasoning, ½ teas of Lawrys salt, ½ teas of Mural of Flavor, pepper. Put in buttered pan, put chicken breasts on top, seasoned with garlic powder and pepper. Next time add another ½ cup of chicken stock. Check the chicken after 35 minutes.
Makes a great one dish meal!

I used chicken broth instead of water and I was amazed by the results! I also threw in some celery for crunch and added celery salt, onion powder, and a bit of granulated garlic in the rice mixture and on top of the chicken. I finished it with parsley and mozzarella on top of the chicken. Delicious!

I followed the instructions for this recipe and was not happy. I got under cooked rice. The chicken did turn out fine but, I added a little extra time. I like the combination of flavors in this recipe so I'll try again using some of the other cooks suggestions.
It was really good! Maybe next time make with french onion soup instead of cream of mushroom!
Increased rice and water amounts (will try chicken broth next time) & seasonings, but no major changes. Always a favorite "go to" when out of ideas to the "what to cook for dinner" question.

I went heavy on everything! 1 cup of stock, 1 cup of jasmine rice (it's what I had), 1/2 tsp of paprika & ground pepper, 1/8 tsp of garlic salt. I seared the chicken breasts in grape seed oil after seasoning with season salt and black pepper. Added coarsely chopped carrots, celery, & a medium yellow onion. Baked at 350 for 40 minutes and pulled the chicken then another 8-10 minutes for rice/veggies to soften a little more. Easy recipe to experiment and I felt like the muppet's Swedish chef making a big 'ol mess!

This is one of my family's favorite dishes! It was a little bland the first time I made it, so I tweaked it a little by rubbing the chicken breasts with olive oil, garlic powder, seasoned salt and an all seasoning like Mrs. Dash before placing them in the rice mixture. If I cook more than 4 breasts, I let it cook a little longer (about 7-10 min.) and I'll add a little more rice and water too.

I thought this dish was really tasty. I used 1 cup of brown rice with 1 cup chicken broth, smoky paprika, pepper & about 2 teaspoons fresh chopped garlic. I used 3 chicken thighs instead of breasts because that is what I had. I cooked it for 45 minutes, then checked it to see if there was enough moisture which I decided there was. I then topped it with French Fried Onion Rings and cooked it another 15 minutes as I thought the chicken was still a bit pink. It got rave reviews from my family and was all eaten. The brown rice had a flavor similar to bulgur. I may add another 2 tablespoons of liquid next time.
I made it according to the recipe and it was just okay. I won't be keeping this recipe.

This was one of the worst meals I have ever prepared. I followed the directions except that I substituted chicken broth for water. It had to cook a LOT longer than 45 minutes. In fact, I cooked it for an extra hour as at 45 minutes, it was like soup. The rice mixture was a mushy concoction of yuk. The chicken was next to flavorless. Needless to say, my husband gave it a big thumbs down and asked that I NEVER prepare this again!

I made this recipe three times. 
The first time I made it exactly as the recipe asked of me, and it was pretty good bu t the creaminess of the mushroom soup mix made it too creamy and wet and just spongy where the rice was concerned. 
The second time I made it with a package of onion soup mix, and it was too salty and too much onion flavor. I couldn't find the chicken in the flavor.
The third time, today, it came out GREAT! I used a 16 ounce can of chicken soup broth, upped the rice to 1 cup and 5 chicken thighs, bone in, in an 8x8x2 (brownie) glass dish at 375 *F for 1 hour. I added also diced green california (ortega) chiles; 2 T juice and 2 T diced chiles strewn on top of the chicken rice mixture and baked it from there. It is gorgeous, not salty, rice light and fluffy and the all around flavor of the rice is beautiful.
Cooked for an hour and rice was still undercooked, and dish was watery. Not sure if should be done with boiling water to get things started.
Classic comfort food. I grew up eating some variation of this recipe. This version was good. I did adjust it a little.

item.name: One Dish Chicken and Rice Bake
